Title: Beware
Author: Elkabyle
Content:
Beware if you want to suspend your subscription... spark won‚Äôt let you watch any content from the date you cancel, NOT from the end of your billing cycle, unlike others like beIN or Netflix.
I suspended my account a week before the end of my cycle, thinking I could watch another week. No luck. And they don‚Äôt want to give a partial refund. They still treat customers very badly. 
Would not recommend for that reason.

Title: Hopeless, it‚Äôs useless for the rugby World Cup.

Content:
$89 for an app that won‚Äôt run on my Apple TV 4. I have the correct app and correct Apple TV but it refuses to accept my password.

The help page is of no help.
I have updated my Apple TV, it‚Äôs good to go. But the app is hopeless, it won‚Äôt logon. Don‚Äôt buy it, it‚Äôs not worth the money for the rugby World Cup.

Title: Worst streaming experience ever - too restrictive
Author: Danger Mouze
Content: Tells me I‚Äôm using in too many devices. I‚Äôve only ever used on my phone and one pc. I log out my sky sport account on the pc and closed the browser. Open the app and it says I cannot watch - too many devices in use. There are no (zero) other devices in use. I understand the desire to stop sharing, but this is blocking legitimate paid for usage. Very very poor. If I need to go out part way through watching the game and want to transfer to my phone to continue watching, I won‚Äôt be able to.

Title: Poor quality

Title: Error occurred

Title: Complete utter joke!!!
Author: Liamdiam
Content: This has got to be one of the worst experiences I‚Äôve ever had trying to watch EPL. Didn‚Äôt manage to catch the start of the game live so tried clicking ‚Äúwatch from the start‚Äù and it sent me to the live playback anyway, giving me the score I spent 2 hours successfully ignoring. The week previous it kept logging out during the live broadcast, almost every 15 minutes. Maybe you should have spent more money developing the app rather than buying the rights to the sporting events you quite clearly aren‚Äôt capable of broadcasting.

Title: Ripped off
Author: 7SMV7
Content: Tried the 7 day trial. Poor experience so cancelled. I cancelled on day 8 so they took a months subscription which is fair enough but even though I have paid for the month apparently I don't have an active subscription. Help desk is appalling. Good luck with the World Cup. My advice is keep your money.

Title: Potential, but limited options at present
Author: ExcusesofPuppets
Content:
Promising, but doesn‚Äôt seem ready.

Not many options to control bandwidth evident, stream would degrade whenever there was a lot of movement, which happens a lot in sport. Not entirely sparks fault, but it would be good to be able to manually adjust bandwidth/quality.

Menu system still a bit cluttered and confusing for me. 

Biggest issue for me is that live streams are out of sync. Audio consistently 2 seconds behind the video. I tried to fix it by looking at spark FAQ and help pages. Absolutely nothing there other than a rather condescending suggestion that I check that my decide isn‚Äôt muted. Checked google for similar apps with this issue and did that, didn‚Äôt fix it.

So I can‚Äôt continue with a sub at this stage. The audio is just too annoying. When this is fixed I‚Äôll reconsider.

Title: Very limited App

Content: Won‚Äôt allow you to use a HDMI cable with an Apple Lightening Adaptor to view streaming on a TV üò¢üò≠üò¢

Sort. It. Out.

The agent told me they are ‚Äúaware customer experience is below expectations‚Äù and ‚Äúwill be making changes to app and streaming services after the World Cup.‚Äù 
How convenient for all outlets selling new tvs (mine‚Äôs 2018 & doesn‚Äôt support app without new generation Apple TV/Chromecast). 
I smell a rat Spark.
